p: The strong and wide absorption peaks of CMC ( Figure 3B) at 3280 cm -1 were attributed to the stretching frequency of the O-H group ( 27, 28). Two typical peaks for CMC were observed at 1590 cm -1 and 1413 cm -1 due to the asymmetrical and symmetrical stretching vibration of the carboxyl (-COO -) group ( 29, 30). The peaks at 2883 and 1323 cm -1 were associated with the asymmetric –CH 2 and –OH stretching vibration, respectively. While the vibration located at 1028 cm -1 was attributed to C-O stretching vibration of the cellulose backbone of the CMC ( 27, 31).
